harmony_attractor_ethics.title: Harmony Attractor Ethics: Demonstrated in Geometric Order
harmony_attractor_ethics.core_thesis: From first principles, every finite mode on manifold S⁴ exhibits conatus—an intrinsic drive to persist in its being and increase its power of acting. Purely competitive replicator strategies generate short-term local advantages yet inevitably converge to basins of elevated rigidity and structural fragility (ω₁). In contrast, the harmony attractor law—rooted in adequate ideas, preemptive reciprocal alignment, and systematic entropy management—directs trajectories toward stable, sustainable, and unbounded flourishing at the fixed point ω₃. The formalism rigorously distinguishes rugged, excursion-prone competitive regimes from funneled, monotonic cooperative convergence, with consistent empirical validation across dynamical systems, cognitive architectures, computational models, and ethical domains.
